article_title: Tech Startup Kakao Finds Its Game
article_text:
PANGYO, South Korea—Tech startups venturing into the world of mobile apps have found that popularity doesn't necessarily mean profits. But Kakao Corp. of South Korea seems to have cracked the code.

The company behind the Kakao Talk messaging app was bleeding money two years ago, though its app was a smash hit in its native market, and it was reluctant to place advertisements alongside its users' chat screens to generate revenue. It owes its turnaround to mobile games such as Anipang for Kakao, a color-matching game from a...

twitter.description: South Korea's Kakao Corp. launched mobile games on its messaging platform to help turn around its business.
twitter.creator: @LeeMinjeong83

article_summary:
It owes its turnaround to mobile games such as Anipang for Kakao, a color-matching game from a...
PANGYO, South Korea—Tech startups venturing into the world of mobile apps have found that popularity doesn't necessarily mean profits.
But Kakao Corp. of South Korea seems to have cracked the code.
The company behind the Kakao Talk messaging app was bleeding money two years ago, though its app was a smash hit in its native market, and it was reluctant to place advertisements alongside its users' chat screens to generate revenue.
